items.title: Si se pudo Thanks to you, Hilda is home again. As Congress...
items.content_html:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Si se pudo Thanks to you, Hilda is home again. As Congress begins to discuss immigration policy that already mentions more surveillance and militarization at the border, it's critical we center the demands of border communities and refuse to use them as a bargaining chip. #revitalizenotmilitarize #nowall
Gracias a todos ustedes, Hilda ya regreso a casa! Mientras el congreso empieza a debatir nuevas propuestas migratorias, que ya propongan mas militarizacion y vigilancia en l...a frontera, es critico que respaldamos a comunidades fronterizas y que no los utlicemos como fichas de negociaciÃ³n.
#freehilda
Special shout out to these organizations who also made this possible American Friends Service Committee AFSC New Mexico

items.title: Call to Action!  Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on...
items.content_html:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Call to Action!
Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on Senator Hickenlooper to support immigrant communities!

This week, Senator Hickenlooper turned his back on the immigrant community in Colorado and around the country by supporting a move to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. While the vote was non-binding, he needs to hear from constituents that these decisions that hurt those most vulnerable to the pandemic will not be tolerated, bef...ore he does it again.

Sanctuary 4 All, a grassroots organization that advocates for the immigrant community in Colorado, has put out a call to action for Coloradans to voice their anger over Hickenlooperâ€™s vote.

WHY: Coloradans elected Senator Hickenlooper to support everyone, regardless of their legal status. He needs to know that this is an unacceptable position to take and that we will hold him accountable.

HOW: Call Senator Hickenlooper today at 202-224-5941 to let him know that everyone deserves relief from the COVID-19 pandemic and that his actions matter to the people of Colorado.

SAMPLE SCRIPT:
My name is [FULL NAME] and I live in [COMMUNITY/ZIP CODE].
I am calling because I am deeply disturbed by Senator Hickenlooperâ€™s vote to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. Everyone in Colorado and around the country deserves support during this pandemic, especially immigrant communities that can be even more vulnerable. As his constituent, I will continue to hold Hickenlooper accountable for all of his votes and demand that he support immigrant families.

GOAL: DSURJâ€™s goal is to generate at least 20 calls by the end of the weekend to send a clear message to Hickenlooper that we are watching each and every one of his votes.

Comment below to let us know you've reached out and please share!

See More

items.title: Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad...
items.content_html:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and that is unaccept...able. Call his office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he couldâ€™ve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid. Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.

See More

items.title: Tania is selling enchiladas this weekend to raise money for her...
items.content_html:
Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Tania is selling enchiladas this weekend to raise money for her application for residency. Sheâ€™s been living in the U.S. since she was a child and now has three children of her own, and obtaining her residency is crucial for her to be able to stay with her family, including her parents, siblings, and children. You can order enchiladas to support Tania and her family at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co
